item.title: [317] Automatic teleporting [devo 2.7]
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:12, topic:339384”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=435771.msg3203322#msg3203322 date=1273536809]

200 rep must be a lie

your using process for this
ever heard of the walking checking method…?

Let’s seeing how well your server ising codeding, then flameing him.
[/quote]wasn’t flame, it was a suggestion, and an opinion

and wat do u mean ising codeding?[/quote]

Thanks jc, and rep does not show in any way a persons abilities tbh.
I can put it anywhere, but process makes it check every half a second so why not there? I’ve tested, and these few lines of code alone do not cause any major server side lagg that I have noticed.

item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

Lol I have a fun idea, some one make an invisible maze and at the end of it you get a prize. Just make all the “invisible” walls automatic tele squares. It might cause some decent lag but it would be cool to see that, as well as how mad people would get having to restart 10000 times and remember the exact path to the prize

item.title: [317] Automatic teleporting [devo 2.7]
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Yes, if your using a delta:

[quote=“Mitko, post:5, topic:339384”][quote author=spy man47 link=topic=435771.msg3200868#msg3200868 date=1273329832]
Could you give us an example for Delta?
[/quote]In the client.java look for boolean process

Under it add:

if (absX == 2660 && absY == 3306) { ToX = 2690; ToY = 3306; heightLevel = 0; sM("You have been automatically teleported."); }Seriously, you don’t know what to tweak to make it work on delta?[/quote]

Thanks for converting it btw

item.title: [317] Automatic teleporting [devo 2.7]
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

While I know this is very easy, I have not yet seen it on these forums and it has been requested by a few of the people on my msn, haters, I didn’t write this for you.

The concept of automatic teleporting is simple, if your player walks onto a certain square with the given coordinates, they would be automatically teleported to a given location.

I tested and wrote this using final devo 2.7, but it would be simple to convert the code.

First off, open up client.java, we need to find the process method, which is called twice every second.

public boolean playerProcess() {
For final devolution 2.7, this method is named playerProcess(), but in other sources i'm pretty sure it's just "public boolean process()", and this is the method where timers etc go.

So just under that line, place this code:

if (absX == 2660 && absY == 3306) { teleportToX = 2690; teleportToY = 3306; heightLevel = 0; CAM().sendMessage("You have been automatically teleported."); }

Now, this code will be called twice every second, and you can change the coordinates to your liking, change the line:

if (absX == 2660 && absY == 3306) {

To change the coordinates which teleport you.
And change the lines:

teleportToX = 2690; teleportToY = 3306;
to change the coordinates which you get teleported to.

Remember, flame all you want, I won’t be wasting my time replying.

Read full topic
